dublin_core.dcvalue: Working with MSH and PCT, ITIDO developed mobile applications that link to a web-based database of information on private sector drug outletsâ€™ premises and personnel and which include a mobile payment component for premises and personnel fees, an SMS-based reporting module for outlets to report on standard indicators related to service delivery, and an SMS-based information exchange module, which allows ADDO and pharmacy personnel to send and receive information, for example, on accreditation requirements or drug recalls.
Jafary Liana, Senior Technical Advisor, MSH Tanzania, Email: jliana@msh.org

Data collection and reporting, Financial transactions and incentives, Supply chain management, Child health, Family planning, HIV/AIDS, Infectious diseases, Malaria and other vector-borne diseases, Maternal health, Newborn health, Non-communicable diseases, Nutrition, Parasitic diseases, Primary Care, Sexual and reproductive health, Tuberculosis, Violence, Water, sanitation, and hygiene
